Abstract: Older shopping malls are closing across America, the victims of newer, more entertaining malls, catalogue and Internet retailers and big-box stores like Wal-Mart; certain developers, architects and planners are now converting these doomed malls into compact new neighborhoods where people park their cars and walk between shops and home; photos (M)
Snippet: Older shopping malls are closing across America, the victims of newer, more entertaining malls, catalogue and Internet retailers and big-box stores like Wal-Mart; certain developers, architects and planners are now converting these doomed malls in...
LeadParagraph: The fully enclosed shopping mall, that island of boxy chain stores and lost apostrophes in a sea of asphalt, was not born in California. But this seems to be the place where people are digging its grave, at least in its present form.

Headline.Main: Retail Darwinism Puts Old Malls in Jeopardy
Headline.PrintHeadline: Retail Darwinism Puts Old Malls in Jeopardy
